title: The Drawing That Explains Political Divides

media:group.media:title: The Drawing That Explains Political Divides
media:group.media:description:
Using a duck-rabbit as a guide to explain how various cognitive biases divide us when it comes to political issues.

If you want to support the channel, here are the best ways to do it:

1) Watch the full video
2) Subscribe if you haven't
3) Share with a friend
4) Support me with a small donation on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/rchapman 

0:00 Intro
0:40 The Biases That Divide Us
08:31 Conclusion

Sources:

The Righteous Mind - Jonathan Haidt
The Oxford Handbook Of Political Psychology - Edited by Huddy, Sears & Levy
Hivemind - Sarah Rose Cavanagh, PhD
Thinking, Fast And Slow - Daniel Kahneman
The Spiral Of Conflict: Naïve Realism - Sammut, Bezzina & Sartawi
